citations.narrative:
The metal trim, around the entrance door of the shelter portion of a rabbit hutch, is broken with sharp edges present.
These sharp edges could harm the rabbit upon entering or exiting the shelter portion of the hutch. This damaged trim
leaves the hutch in disrepair and serves as a means to cause injury to the rabbit housed therein. Housing facilities shall
be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury.
TO BE CORRECTED BY: MAY 26, 2022

The fencing around the goats and sheep is composed of wooden planks and chainlink on the front and sides but only
chainlink on the back. The chainlink has been detached from the wooden fence in the right, rear corner. Also, the rear
chainlink fence fabric is no longer attached to the fence posts. The fence fabric has been stepped on by the goats thus
lowering it half way down towards the ground. These damaged areas leave the fence in disrepair and it no longer fully
contains the animals. Damaged fencing should be repaired in order to maintain structual strength and to fully contain the
animals housed therein.
TO BE CORRECTED BY: JUNE 2, 2022
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the licensee.
End Section

narrative:
3.50(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The metal trim, around the entrance door of the shelter portion of a rabbit hutch, is broken with sharp edges present.  
These sharp edges could harm the rabbit upon entering or exiting the shelter portion of the hutch.  This damaged trim 
leaves the hutch in disrepair and serves as a means to cause injury to the rabbit housed therein.  Housing facilities shall 
be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury. 
 
TO BE CORRECTED BY:  MAY 26, 2022 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The fencing around the goats and sheep is composed of wooden planks and chainlink on the front and sides but only 
chainlink on the back.  The chainlink has been detached from the wooden fence in the right, rear corner.  Also, the rear 
chainlink fence fabric is no longer attached to the fence posts.  The fence fabric has been stepped on by the goats thus 
lowering it half way down towards the ground.  These damaged areas leave the fence in disrepair and it no longer fully 
contains the animals.  Damaged fencing should be repaired in order to maintain structual strength and to fully contain the 
animals housed therein.

TO BE CORRECTED BY:  JUNE 2, 2022 
 
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End Section
